NASA.Definition: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (U.S. space agency) focused on aeronautics and space exploration.

Astronomy_Basics.Star: A self-luminous sphere of plasma powered by nuclear fusion.
Astronomy_Basics.Galaxy: A gravitationally bound system of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter.
Astronomy_Basics.Exoplanet: A planet orbiting a star beyond our solar system.
Astronomy_Basics.Black_Hole: A region of spacetime with gravity so strong that not even light can escape.
Astronomy_Basics.Solar_System: The Sun and all celestial bodies bound to it by gravity.

Physics_Concepts.Fusion: The nuclear process by which lighter elements combine into heavier ones, releasing energy.
Physics_Concepts.Light_Year: Distance light travels in one year (~9.46 trillion km).
Physics_Concepts.Astronomical_Unit: Average distance between Earth and the Sun (~150 million km).
Physics_Concepts.Redshift: Increase in wavelength of light due to object moving away (used to measure cosmic expansion).

Exploration_Programs.Artemis: Modern program aiming to return humans to the Moon and beyond.
Exploration_Programs.Voyager: Twin probes launched in 1977 exploring outer planets and now interstellar space.
Exploration_Programs.Hubble: Space telescope operating since 1990, observing visible and ultraviolet light.
Exploration_Programs.JWST: Infrared telescope exploring early galaxies and exoplanets.
